meanings.definition: Existing or occurring before the existence of life.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the prebiological conditions on the planet.
meanings.sent2: The prebiological era was a time of great mystery.
meanings.sent3: The prebiological world was like a blank canvas waiting for life to paint its colors.
meanings.sent4: The prebiological landscape was a silent stage before the grand play of life began.
meanings.sent5: In the prebiological realm, only the whispers of potential life could be heard.

meanings.definition: Relating to the period before the emergence of life on Earth.
meanings.sent1: The prebiological environment was harsh and unforgiving.
meanings.sent2: Scientists explore the prebiological conditions to understand early Earth.
meanings.sent3: The prebiological era was like a quiet library waiting for the first book to be written.
meanings.sent4: The prebiological stage was a dark canvas yearning for the first stroke of life.
meanings.sent5: The prebiological world was a vast emptiness, pregnant with the promise of life.
